body:
All services start with a start page.

When you install the editor (with or without the 'example service' installed), it includes a start page. You can edit this page for the service you're building.

If you're running the service on port 3000, access the start page at [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000).

You can always quickly get to your start page by clicking:

* the GOV.UK link (top left)
* your service's name (top centre)

## Top navigation bar

The top blue navigation bar has 6 links.

### Dashboard

Shows you:

* the pages in your service
* a link to edit your service details (name, phase etc)

### Page flow

A flow diagram of how your service's pages link together.

### Live view

Shows you how the page will display to a user.

If the page or its components contain conditional logic, the page will display (or not) based on answers the user has 
already given.

### Preview mode

Shows you all the possible contents of the page. For example, if the page has conditional logic to show one of several possible components to any given user, preview mode will show you **all** of the possible components.

You'll see an extra navigation bar (light blue) at the top of the screen, allowing you to easily navigate forwards and backwards through your form.

### Wysiwyg mode

An editing mode, similar to preview: it shows all components on a page.

Allows you to edit each component on the page, by clicking on the pencil (âœŽ) or brackets ('{}') icons on the left.

### Instance mode

A 'back end' or 'CMS' editing mode.

It allows you to edit all properties that you can edit for a page, component or item, and the raw JSON.
heading: Page view and editing modes
